security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown content with code examples. The skill does not execute any code, access filesystem, read environment variables, or make network requests. All code blocks are example patterns for API development that would run in the user's own environment.

content.value_statement: Building scalable APIs requires mastering async patterns, error handling, and rate limiting. This skill provides ready-to-use code patterns for circuit breakers, caching, testing, and production configurations that work across Python, Node.js, and Go.
actual_capabilities: Design RESTful and GraphQL APIs with modern patterns
Implement async/await patterns with connection pooling
Add rate limiting with Redis sliding window algorithm
Create circuit breaker for fault tolerance
Write async API tests with pytest and httpx
limitations: Does not generate complete API projects from templates
Does not connect to databases or external services
Does not deploy or configure production infrastructure

use_cases.title: Build production APIs
use_cases.description: Implement async APIs with proper error handling, rate limiting, and circuit breakers for production reliability.

use_cases.title: Configure API monitoring
use_cases.description: Set up Prometheus metrics, structured logging, health checks, and performance optimization for API services.

use_cases.title: Create API tests
use_cases.description: Write comprehensive unit and integration tests for API endpoints with mocking and pagination validation.

prompt_templates.title: Create async API client
prompt_templates.scenario: Need HTTP client with retry logic
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an async API client in Python with connection pooling, retry logic, and metrics tracking for high-performance HTTP requests.

prompt_templates.title: Add rate limiting
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement rate limiting middleware using Redis sliding window algorithm with configurable limits per user or IP address.

prompt_templates.title: Design API versioning
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an API versioning strategy supporting header-based, URL path-based, and query parameter-based version detection.

prompt_templates.title: Set up API testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Write async API tests using pytest and httpx including unit tests, integration tests, and rate limiting validation.

output_examples.input: Create an async API client with connection pooling and retry logic
output: Created AsyncAPIClient class with TCPConnector for connection pooling
Added retry logic using exponential backoff
Included metrics tracking decorator for request duration and status codes
Configured timeout handling and session lifecycle management

best_practices: Always use connection pooling with limits to prevent resource exhaustion
Implement circuit breakers to prevent cascade failures in distributed systems
Use structured logging with correlation IDs for API request tracing
anti_patterns: Making synchronous HTTP calls in async handlers
Skipping rate limiting on public API endpoints
Not validating input schema before processing requests

faq.question: Which programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Patterns work with Python, Node.js, Go, and other languages. Code examples focus on Python async patterns.

faq.question: What are the performance limits for rate limiting?
faq.answer: Default is 100 requests per minute with configurable limits. Redis-backed implementation supports high concurrency.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing frameworks?
faq.answer: Patterns are framework-agnostic. Examples show FastAPI and aiohttp but concepts apply to Express, Gin, and others.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these patterns?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides patterns. No data leaves your environment when implementing these patterns.

faq.question: Why is my async API running slowly?
faq.answer: Check for blocking synchronous calls, missing connection pooling, or unoptimized database queries in async contexts.

faq.question: How does this compare to Express.js or FastAPI directly?
faq.answer: This skill provides patterns that work within any framework. FastAPI and Express handle routing while patterns add reliability.
